Posts.Content: Jun 26, 2011 11:18AM worriednlost wrote: For anyone who is curious about food and its effects on cancer i stumbled on a site with lots of good information. Here is the link to it and a quick excerpt form the home page of the site. http://foodforbreastcancer.com/  Food for Breast Cancer We provide information on how various foods and other factors affect breast cancer risk, prevention, and prognosis. The findings are drawn exclusively from scientific studies and updated as new research becomes available. Our goal is to provide breast cancer patients, survivors and those at high risk for breast cancer with information to help them prevent and survive breast cancer.

Posts.Content: Jul 9, 2011 01:00AM worriednlost wrote: Finally got the pathologies report and now i am more confused than ever. Here is some info from it maybe someone can help me understand it a bit. I am guessing its triple negative Invasive ductal carcinoma with lobular features. Confused about all the sizes in the report. CLINICAL HISTORY left breast, 9 x 7 mm ca - nodes positive. Core biopsy - diagnosis, ER, HER. MACROSCOPIC DESCRIPTION 3 rubbery fibrofatty cores measuring 0.7, 0.7, 1.1 cm in length x 0.1cm in diameter . Submitted in toto ANATOMICAL DIAGNOSIS Invasive ductal carcinoma with lobular features (e-cadherin positive, focally showing incomplete membrane staining) -size 4mm in longest dimension as measured on slide -invasive tumor necrosis noted -no in-situ component -lymphovascular invasion cannot be excluded HORMONE RECEPTORS AND HER2 estrogen and progesterone negative (staining intensity: weak) her2 equivocal page 2 of report shows more info and dated a lot later.. FLUORESCENCE IN SITU HYBRIDIZATION REPORT HER2/CEP-17 RATIO 1.1 INTERPRETATION: NEGATIVE: HER2/NEU amplification NOT identified in this material NOTE : Immunostain p63 has been used in evaluation

Posts.Content: Jun 22, 2011 04:28PM worriednlost wrote: If anyone is monitoring this thread here is an update.. My mom was seen by a specialist today and was told that it is cancer. At this point the mass was 9cm. Doctor took a biopsy and scheduled a PET scan. Also he said she is going to need chemo. The biopsy results will take a week and the apt. for PET scan would take 2 weeks. We are in Montreal, Canada and getting seen by doctors at the major hospital. Don't know how to react or what to think as I am in total shock.

Posts.Content: Jun 22, 2011 08:12PM worriednlost wrote: After speaking to the surgeon he seemed sure that it was cancer and talked about the PET scan and Chemo.. I am still very confused about that.. Does it mean she has a malignant tumor ? Does it mean he suspects it is ? If the specialist said its cancer does it mean really low chance of it being B9 ? I guess biopsy is the sure way to know what we are dealing with? But after doctors visit it feels like we are diagnosed partially and not the diagnosis I was looking for.  Another thing that worried me more is the PET test does that mean doc suspects spread of cancer ? Pardon me if I don't make sense or not expressing myself properly.  @Barbe1958  Thanks for explaining that to me I didn't think of it that way..
